page.title: 06Equestrian Centre & a Pub.
page.content: {SYSTON EQUESTRIAN CENTRE The centre stands on 4.5 acres of land. 200 people each week have riding lessons. They come from as far away as Market Harborough. It costs Â£4.00 for half an hours tuition on lead reign and Â£3.00 per hour off lead reign. The centre owns 28 horses.The oldest is Bronze (23years).Each horse eats four and a half bales of hay per week. { {THE MIDLAND}(pub-situated Melton Road) It was originally called The Midland Railway and was built before the road bridge which now crosses the railway line. Two additional storeys were added to bring it level with the road bridge. The basement is thought to be haunted by the ghost of a murdered sheep dealer. Opening hours are:- 11.00 _ 14.30. and 18.30 _ 23.00.
